posts.title: Probate Administration: Navigating the Legal Landscape
posts.description: Navigating the probate process can be emotionally and legally complex, especially after the loss of a loved one. In this article, we break down the key stages of probate administration in Kenya, including obtaining a grant of probate or letters of administration, handling estate assets, settling debts, and distributing inheritance. Whether you're an executor, administrator, or beneficiary, this guide will help you understand your rights, responsibilities, and the legal framework involved. Learn how to avoid common pitfalls and ensure a smooth, compliant administration of the deceasedâ€™s estate.

posts.title: Understanding Wills and Testaments in Kenya
posts.description: A will is a legal document that outlines how a person's assets should be distributed after their death. In Kenya, the law recognizes both written and oral wills, but written wills are more common and easier to enforce. This article explains the requirements for creating a valid will in Kenya, including the need for witnesses, the importance of clear language, and the role of executors. It also discusses how to revoke or amend a will and the implications of dying without a will (intestate).

posts.title: The Role of Executors in Estate Administration
posts.description: Executors play a crucial role in managing and distributing a deceased person's estate. This article outlines the responsibilities of executors in Kenya, including applying for a grant of probate, collecting and managing estate assets, paying debts and taxes, and distributing the remaining assets to beneficiaries. It also covers the legal requirements for being appointed as an executor, the importance of transparency and communication with beneficiaries, and the potential challenges executors may face, such as disputes among beneficiaries or claims against the estate.
